page.title: 01In and Around Osmotherly
page.content: This area of great natural beauty and varied scenery, pastureland, woodland and moorland, lies within the North Yorkshire Moors National Park. Two thirds of the land is cultivated, some under cash crops, but most under pasture and fodder crops for dairy cattle and sheep. Higher ground provides rough grazing. This gives away to moorland, supporting its own wildlife, and reared game. 900 people live within the area, mostly in the larger village of Osmotherly. Forty people live in Thimbleby, others in outlying farmsteads. Most houses are built from local quarried sandstone. Few people work on the land. A sawmill, publichouses and garages employ local people. Most of the working population commute to Northallerton and Teeside, where most bulk shopping is done. In winter
